name: The Jodhpur Royal Azure Prince Coat
description1: Deep sapphire velvet with a structured imperial cut; the silhouette of a modern Maharaja.
description2: A masterpiece of royal tailoring, this blue Prince Coat features a high Mandarin collar and hand-finished piping. The Italian velvet fabric provides a regal sheen, making it the premier choice for elite evening receptions.

name: Maharaja Crimson & Gold Zardosi Sherwani
description1: A breathtaking fusion of molten gold embroidery on a bed of royal crimson silk.
description2: Designed for the groom of the decade, this Sherwani features intricate Zardosi hand-embroidery. The red and gold palette honors centuries of tradition, while the structured shoulder padding provides a commanding royal presence.

name: The Obsidian Rajputana Gold-Trim Sherwani
description1: Pitch-black raw silk accented with hand-beaten gold thread work.
description2: This black and gold Sherwani represents the 'Warrior Prince' aesthetic. The dark fabric is contrasted by heavy gold embroidery on the cuffs and collar, offering a look that is both mysterious and immensely wealthy.

name: Nawab of Awadh Midnight Charcoal Sherwani
description1: Understated power in midnight hues; a monochromatic marvel of silk weaving.
description2: For the man who commands the room without a word. This dark charcoal Sherwani uses tonal embroidery to create a textured, shadow-like effect. Perfect for high-profile winter weddings.

name: Gulistan Rose-Damask Waistcoat
description1: Hand-woven red roses on a rich silk canvas; the heartbeat of the celebration.
description2: A vibrant addition to any Kurta, this waistcoat features a vintage floral damask pattern in deep rose red. The brass buttons are etched with royal crests, adding a layer of heritage to a modern silhouette.

name: The Mewar Dynasty Cobalt Sherwani
description1: Cobalt blue silk paired with silver-toned thread for a celestial finish.
description2: Inspired by the palaces of Udaipur, this blue Sherwani captures the reflection of the lake at night. Its slim-fit cut and minimalist embroidery make it a versatile choice for luxury events.

name: Imperial Sun-Drenched Gold Sherwani
description1: Pure liquid gold aesthetic; the ultimate attire for the center of attention.
description2: A full-body gold tissue silk Sherwani with intricate self-embroidery. This piece is reserved for the highest tier of royalty, reflecting light from every angle with its metallic weave.

name: The Amer Fort Gilded Prince Coat
description1: A golden armor of elegance; structured, short-length, and purely regal.
description2: This gold Prince Coat brings the traditional length into a modern, sharper cut. The fabric is a heavy brocade that holds its shape perfectly, ensuring you look like a statue of perfection at any gala.

name: Royal Sanganeer Red & Gold Heritage Coat
description1: Traditional block-print motifs reimagined with gold-wire embroidery.
description2: A classic red and gold combination that never fails. This Sherwani uses a softer silk blend for better movement while maintaining the heavy, rich look of imperial ceremony wear.

name: The Sovereign Shadow Black & Gold Sherwani
description1: Gold filigree dancing on a midnight sky; the pinnacle of black-tie ethnic wear.
description2: This second iteration of our black and gold Sherwani features a more dense 'Jal' (net) pattern of embroidery, covering the chest and shoulders for a heavier, more armored royal look.

name: Nizam's Court Grey Silk Sherwani with Jewel Chain
description1: Sophisticated dove grey silk featuring a signature 24k-gold-plated chest chain.
description2: This Sherwani defines the 'Modern Nawab.' The clean, sharp grey silk is accented by a functional gold chain brooch pinned near the heart, representing a lineage of honor and nobility.
